page.title: 14FARMING IN WISTON cont.
page.content: Secondary cover was woodland,mainly natural deciduous trees,one farmer had planted conifers twenty five years ago and is now self sufficient in fencing posts,saving 60p per post! Four of the five farmers who produced milk expect to be affected by the E.E.C.quotas this year having escaped penalties last year due to the drought and the natural decrease in milk production.Farmers are feeling the pinch whatever they do. Few major changes have taken place over the last few years.In a farming area only two out of the seven farms still have tied cottages.All tractors are British except for one.All of the farmers were interestes in wild life and left wood land for conservation areas.They all had foxeson their land and are not very popular.The farmers wives shopped mainly in Haverfordwest. THE END.
